name: Ratatosk
damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The ratatosk makes two Gore or Annoying Chitter attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Divisive Chatter, if available.

actions.name: Gore
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Annoying Chitter
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage.

actions.name: Divisive Chatter (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The ratatosk causes division and strife in up to four creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 14 Charisma saving throw or be irritated for 1 minute. While irritated, a creature must spend its action on each of its turns arguing with, complaining about, or otherwise expressing unhappiness toward one of its allies over a trivial matter. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.desc:
The ratatosk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or somatic components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (save DC 14):
At will: animal messenger, message
3/day each: sending, suggestion
1/day: commune (as an action)

bonus_actions.name: Skitter
bonus_actions.desc: The ratatosk takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reactions.name: Desperate Lies
reactions.desc: When a creature the ratatosk can see targets it with an attack, the ratatosk tells a lie while pointing to another creature within 5 feet of it. The attacker must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or believe the lie and attack the other creature instead.

special_abilities.name: Magic Resistance
special_abilities.desc: The ratatosk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
